title: 112_hr2557
content: Establishment of a Tick-Borne Diseases Advisory Committee. The Secretary of Health and Human Services will establish the Tick-Borne Diseases Advisory Committee to advise on interagency coordination, communication, and collaboration efforts related to tick-borne diseases. The Tick-Borne Diseases Advisory Committee will include appointed members from the scientific community to ensure a broad spectrum of viewpoints in public health policy decisions and advise Federal agencies on priorities related to Lyme and tick-borne diseases. The Tick-Borne Diseases Advisory Committee will include representatives from the scientific community, tick-borne disease voluntary organizations, health care providers, patient representatives, and State officials. The Tick-Borne Diseases Advisory Committee will include representatives from State and local health departments, national organizations, and federal agencies overseeing tick-borne disease activities. The Secretary will ensure diversity in scientific perspectives among members. The Tick-Borne Diseases Advisory Committee will include representatives from various federal agencies, with the Secretary designating the Assistant Secretary for Health as the co-chairperson. Members will serve 4-year terms, and vacancies will be filled in the same manner as the original appointment. The Tick-Borne Diseases Advisory Committee members will be appointed to fill vacancies for unexpired terms and serve until successors take office. Meetings will be held at least twice a year, with additional meetings as needed, and agenda items can be added by members. Meeting proceedings will be conducted as required by law and regulations. A report must be submitted within 1 year of the enactment date. The Tick-Borne Diseases Advisory Committee will submit an annual report to the Secretary, detailing its functions, members, activities, and recommendations. $250,000 is authorized for each fiscal year from 2012 to 2016 for the Committee's operations. The Tick-Borne Diseases Advisory Committee will receive $250,000 annually from 2012 to 2016 for its operations, with funds used for expenses and per diem costs in accordance with the Federal Advisory Committee Act. Voting members cannot be permanent salaried employees.
